Text.Value: Speak the magic words: 'Give me my heart's desire.'
*Nothing happens.*
Be ready. I suspect Raphael will throws a tantrum when the other children touch his toys.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: Are we prepared for Raphael's fury? We will survive the hells through strategy, not strength.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: Leave.
What? This hammer can free Orpheus from his astral prison. Take it -
We take the Hammer and break Orpheus free. The traitor prince will perish by my hand.
This is not over. There is no lock that cannot be undone.
Careful now. Last thing we want to do is call forth Raphael's ugly mug before we need to.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: *If the inscription is accurate, this hammer may be the key to breaking Orpheus free.*
Be ready. A devil does not so readily give up his toys.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: *A magical field surrounds the item, preventing you - or anyone - from touching it. You surmise it's controlled by a vocal component: magic words.*
Reach out to sense how far you can reach before being repelled.
*That which you seek is still so close, yet so far.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [HUS][GUS-260218] The magical field force already inside the editor as speaker.

Text.Value: *There it is: Your contract with Raphael, your signature bold at the bottom. The earthy smell of fresh ink still lingers.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [HUS][GUS-260218] The magical field force already inside the editor as speaker.

Text.Value: Ready yourself. Raphael won't give up his treasure without a fight.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: *Your contract is within reach. But your theft won't go unnoticed.*
Immediately.
*The Orphic Hammer is within reach. But your theft won't go unnoticed.*
Careful. Stealing the most precious item in this place is hardly going to go unnoticed...

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: *There is an inscription on the pedestal: 'When the Orphic Hammer strikes like thunder, even Astral chains are torn asunder.'*
Might I suggest that was a little too easy? Steal this, and we should brace ourselves for what comes next. I fear the hells will truly let loose.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: *It appears to be protected by an energy field of some kind, but you're not familiar with this magic.*
*There it is - the Orphic Hammer. Right within reach.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [HUS][GUS-260218] The magical field force already inside the editor as speaker.

Text.Value: I'm all for thieving, but let's not be hasty. Steal this and the devil will notice.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: Careful! No matter how stealthy you are, a squirrel will always know when you have stolen his nuts. Boo has learned this, at great cost.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: It is I, Raphael. Lower your defences.
*Before you can reach out, a compulsion in your head stops you. 'NO,' it seems to say.*
*An ornate hammer hovers above the pedestal.*

EditorData.VFXTags: [HUS][GUS-260218] The magical field force already inside the editor as speaker.

Text.Value: You know the words. Now speak them.
Careful. The theft of the most important item in this place will surely not go unnoticed.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: On the pedestal, depending on the flow, there is either Orphic Hammer or contract. To avoid making two alternative nodes we should have something vague that will work with both

Text.Value: *The magic blinks away at your words.*

EditorData.SFXTags: [HUS][GUS-260218] Sound of the magical force field disappearing.
EditorData.VFXTags: [HUS][GUS-260218] The magical field force surrounding the hammer disappear.

Synopsis:
The dialogue for when players try to pick up the treasure while it's still locked.
Through this dialogue players can also remove the defense.

Node about the Orphic Hammer should be in sync with LOW_HouseOfHope_AD_Treasure02Plaque dialogue
